image.altText: A close-up shot of a doctor noting down symptoms of a patient on a form with a stethoscope hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor has been accused of discrimination for cancelling a teenage transgender patient's routine appointment for adolescent vaccinations.

title.children: Human rights complaint made after transgender teen's GP appointment cancelled

image.altText: Lleyton Hewitt and Nick Kyrgios share a laugh together

props.synopsis: Nick Kyrgios appears to be in the good graces of Lleyton Hewitt once again after being named in Australia's Davis Cup team for the qualifying tie in Sweden.

title.children: Nick Kyrgios named in Davis Cup team after five-year absence

image.altText: Woman lying in curled up position on couch.

props.synopsis: The researchers hope their project can be used to build a profile of endometriosis sufferers.Â

title.children: No 'cure' but research could improve life for endometriosis patients

image.altText: A woman in front of a horse yard fence pats a horse in the yard.

props.synopsis: Many lessons came from the 2003 Canberra firestorm, including how to better care for horses during a bushfire emergency. This summer, horse owners are being urged to have emergency safety plans in place for their animals.

title.children: During Canberra's firestorm, Jane protected horses. She wishes she hadn't

image.altText: Two men sitting at an outdoor table in bushland

props.synopsis: Friends, family and strangers have travelled from across the country to help search for 23-year-old Hadi Nazari who's been missing since Boxing Day.

title.children: Friends and strangers rally to find hiker missing in Kosciuszko National Park

image.altText: a man appears relieved in his surf ski

props.synopsis: Rowers are celebrating after crossing the finish line in Eden of what is considered to be the toughest and longest surfboat race in the world.

title.children: Rowers battle blisters to finish gruelling seven-day George Bass race

image.altText: CCTV screens set up at summernats 37

props.synopsis: With 130,000 people expected to come through the gates at Exhibition Park in Canberra in the next few days and 99 per cent of them expected to do the right thing, here's what goes into keeping an eye on the 1 per cent of "troublemakers".

title.children: 50 cameras, 40 staff watching for potential 'troublemakers' at Summernats

image.altText: israeli emergency workers gather around a mini bus that was allegedly shot at by palestinians

props.synopsis: Two women in their 60s and a man about 40 years old were pronounced dead at the scene, while seven passengers were wounded, Israel's ambulance service said.

title.children: Three Israelis killed in northern West Bank attack, says ambulance service

image.altText: A young girl lies in a hospital bed. The skin on her face is red and inflamed and her arm is covered in plastic.

props.synopsis: Daniella Jacobs-Herd faces a decade of skin grafts after suffering severe burns from a Temu jumper purchased online, which failed to comply with Australian safety standards.Â

title.children: Girl suffers severe burns after Temu jumper ignites 'in a split second'

image.altText: Two old men sit on a tram, one types on a lap top

props.synopsis: Studies show social connectedness leads to better health outcomes for men. Jack and Richard's lifelong friendship offers a masterclass in the power of mateship.

title.children: Jack and Richard met in 1964. The power of mateship changed their lives

image.altText: White foam is sprayed from a yellow fire truck towards a plane that is parked on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: Passengers describe feeling the Etihad Airways plane speeding up as it travelled down the runway before being jolted as the plane braked suddenly and came to a halt.

title.children: Passengers praise crew's 'calm' handling of aborted Melbourne take-off

image.altText: A group of police officers walk down a street in front of a shop front at night

props.synopsis: South Australian police officers will be deployed to Alice Springs, following calls for assistance from the Northern Territory police commissioner.Â

title.children: SA police officers deployed to Alice Springs amid ongoing crime

image.altText: man dressed in black archbishop robes raises his hands

props.synopsis: During Trump's first administration, Cardinal McElroy sharply criticised his plan to launch a mass deportation campaign targeting millions of immigrants living in the United States.

title.children: Pope names Trump critic as Washington DC's new archbishop

image.altText: The AI Lucas, a tall, grey-haired blue-eyed man standing inside a kitchen.

props.synopsis: As the popularity of AI-generated companions grows, there are calls for greater regulation of a rapidly expanding world that some fear is disconnecting users from real-life human relationships.

title.children: AI partners are on the rise, raising complex questions for our society

image.altText: Snow flying as dozens of people throw snowballs

props.synopsis: Cold weather created dangerous travel conditions from the US's central and southern states all the way to the east coast early on Monday.

title.children: Winter blast grips US from Midwest to east coast

image.altText: Nick Kyrgios and Novak Djokovic embrace in mid-court as a packed crowd cheers behind them after a match.

props.synopsis: The scenes that greeted Nick Kyrgios and Novak Djokovic's doubles matches at the Brisbane International were among the most raucous of the entire week, but seven-time major winner Jamie Murray says doubles is dying.

title.children: Kyrgios and Djokovic showed doubles draws crowds but elsewhere it's dying

image.altText: A close-up shot of a doctor noting down symptoms of a patient on a form with a stethoscope hanging around his neck.

props.synopsis: A Canberra doctor has been accused of discrimination for cancelling a teenage transgender patient's routine appointment for adolescent vaccinations.

title.children: Transgender teenager's appointment cancelled by Canberra medical centre

image.altText: a picture of tree branches in front of the sky

props.synopsis: A tree expert says many are unaware how dangerous trees can be and urges people to look up for the warning signs.

title.children: Recent deaths and injuries from falling trees prompt arborist warning

image.altText: Small girl and boy on aqua blue waterslide

props.synopsis: An ambitious foreshore development transforms a rural town on South Australia's Eyre Peninsula into tourist destination, rather than a "toilet stop" for travellers.Â

title.children: Controversial $11m water park and marina help save drought-hit town

image.altText: Zendara wears a burnt orange strapless gown with a sweetheart neckline

props.synopsis: Awards season has kicked off in Los Angeles with the 82nd Golden Globes Awards â heralded by TV and film stars rocking fancy frocks on the red carpet.

title.children: Golden Globes red carpet: Zendaya shines in orange as stars take on gilded trend

image.altText: A graphic of a girl with social media icons around her head

props.synopsis: Researchers believe a public health response could be more effective than the federal government's upcoming social media ban for teenagers under 16.

title.children: 'Evidence is weak': Child psychiatrist criticises youth social media ban

image.altText: A concept image of the proposed Hobart stadium at Macquarie Poi nt.

props.synopsis: The ABC has obtained a more detailed cost estimate for the proposed Macquarie Point stadium, with newly-released information showing a cost of $171 million over 30 years for maintenance and upkeep â on top of its construction cost.

title.children: More costs revealed for Hobart's proposed Macquarie Point stadium

image.altText: Nusra Latif Qureshi, with long brown hair and long bright blue dress, stands smiling in a room with bright painting on wall.

props.synopsis: In her first major solo exhibition, Melbourne-based Nusra Latif Qureshi takes her deep understanding of Mughal painting and Urdu storytelling traditions, and brings her own powerful perspective to them.

title.children: Artist Nusra Latif Qureshi refuses to paint women as symbols of beauty

image.altText: A composite image showing the faces of Elon Musk and Nigel Farage

props.synopsis: The world's richest man, who has forged a political alliance with Donald Trump, says Mr Farage should quit as leader of Britain's right-wing Reform UK Party.

title.children: Elon Musk calls for Reform UK leader Nigel Farage to quit

image.altText: Amelia, wearing headphones and facing towards a moving train away from the camera.

props.synopsis: Sensitivity to everyday sounds is a common disorder, especially among autistic people such as Amelia Geiss. But what causes it and how can we help manage it?

title.children: My autism makes me sensitive to sound, but I've learnt to turn down the volume

image.altText: Indian cricket fans play a drum and wave an Indian flag in the crowd.

props.synopsis: The historic series will be remembered for its enormous crowds, partly due to the massive turnout of fans from Australia's growing Indian community.

title.children: Cricket's historic summer fuelled by growing diaspora's influence

image.altText: A cargo ship on the sea.

props.synopsis: Taiwan is investigating damage to an undersea cable near Yehliu, suspected to have been caused by a Cameroonian-registered cargo ship with links to mainland China, amid growing concerns over maritime sabotage worldwide.

title.children: Undersea cable near Taiwan damaged in suspected sabotage

image.altText: A woman with dark hair and wearing a green vest

props.synopsis: Police say new intelligence has led them to search an area of bushland west of Geelong for missing Bannockburn woman Lorrin Whitehead. She hasn't been seen since leaving her home in 2013.

title.children: Police to search bushland for missing Victorian woman Lorrin Whitehead

image.altText: An oil slick on the ocean surface with a tanker in the background.

props.synopsis: The energy giant has pleaded guilty to causing an oil spill in 2022, that leaked 25,000 litres of oil off WA's north-west coast. Santos will pay a $10,000 fine and $9,700 in court costs for failing to prevent the spill.

title.children: Gas giant Santos fined $10,000 for 25,000-litre oil spill off Pilbara coast

image.altText: A blurred photo of trucks and a motorhome driving on the Bruce Highway

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese's opening gambit for 2025 â a year in which an election is due to be held no later than May 17 â underscores the importance of the nation's northern jurisdictions to the coming contest.

title.children: Albanese unveils $7.2b highway upgrade as election speculation looms

image.altText: Stock image of a Virgin plane

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old man faces court in Fiji over the alleged rape and sexual assault of a 21-year-old Melbourne woman in the south Pacific nation.Â

title.children: Man faces Fijian court over alleged rape of Virgin Airlines crew member

image.altText: Proxy mum with Alex

props.synopsis: ARFID is a newly recognised eating disorder, which became an official diagnosis for adults and children in 2013. For 12-year-old Alex*, the diagnosis came as a relief after years bouncing around the medical system.

title.children: Eating disorder ARFID is almost as common as anorexia

image.altText: a young woman smiling into the camera

props.synopsis: Chloe Jade Mason was found unconscious in the front yard of a house on Railway Parade at Caboolture in the early hours of December 22.Â

title.children: Two brothers charged over woman's alleged shooting murder north of Brisbane

image.altText: woman sitting at desk inside her catamaran

props.synopsis: Living aboard a boat has many advantages, offering residents a sense of community, security and a flexible lifestyle. For this reason, some women are giving up their homes on land to live on the water.

title.children: Single, older women are selling their homes to live on boats in marinas
